page.title: 15THE MINERS' STRIKE
page.content: The president of the NATIONAL UNION OF MINEWORKERS decided that all the mining industry should come out on strike.After about two to three weeks the women's action group began to cook dinners for miners,miner's wives and children.Many miners had to give up their houses and sell some of their goods and some found it hard to buy food. Everyday on the News it was all about the strike.The NCB organised meetings which didn't work.About three to four months later some miners began to go back to work and this caused a lot of violence even in Bentley.It was in all the papers.There were marches taking place in all areas.
